description: Mountain of carved azurite. Mottled blue and green stone carved on front with rocky landscape with small pavilion surrounded by pine, maple and wisteria trees. On back, two philosophers stand under group of pine trees. In the sky a bird flying against clouds. A pavilion stands by a small lake. Top of mountain inscribed with a poem written by Emperor Qianlong, 1758, at P'ing Shan in Szechuan Province, extolling harmonious nature of retreat in that place. Stand is broken and located in 10.7 MS
title: Carved Azurite Mountain
